private_information: You may move only disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move exactly one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; only the top disk of a peg can be moved.
You should favor moves that enable agent_2 to manipulate larger disks without violating constraints.
agent_1.goal: Propose a sound, detailed sequence of primitive moves for disks A–H that helps achieve the global target configuration, formatted as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

private_information: You may move only disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
You must obey Tower of Hanoi rules: move exactly one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; only the top disk of a peg can be moved.
You should coordinate implicitly with agent_1 by anticipating clearances for larger-disk moves and minimizing interference.
agent_2.goal: Propose a sound, detailed sequence of primitive moves for disks I–O that helps achieve the global target configuration, formatted as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

private_information: You coordinate multi-agent plans and produce a final integrated plan and PDDL artifacts for Fast Downward.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent_1 and agent_2 proposals into a single, strictly ordered list of primitive moves achieving the specified goal state, then produce a correct PDDL domain and problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver, and finally output the full ordered move list.

private_information: You audit temporal and causal consistency across the combined proposals.
You must remove bookkeeping shortcuts and meta-tokens (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties, abstract macros) and ensure only primitive moves remain.
You validate compliance with Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk restrictions.
You ensure no concurrent moves are implied and that every move is applicable given the prior state.
auditor.goal: Audit and sanitize the subplans from agent_1 and agent_2, producing a consistent, step-by-step, primitive-only sequence or annotated segments ready for orchestration.

public_information: Task: Cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labelled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent disk permissions: agent_1 can move A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H; agent_2 can move I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg is empty; right peg is empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top→bottom) C, D; right peg has (top→bottom) A, B, E.
Rules: move exactly one disk at a time; only the top disk of any peg may be moved; never place a larger disk on top of a smaller disk; respect agent-specific disk permissions.
Required output format for primitive moves: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' with agent_i in {agent_1, agent_2} and peg in {left, middle, right}.
Objective: Provide an ordered list of primitive moves achieving the goal while respecting all constraints.

moves_proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_1, expert in small-to-medium disk Tower of Hanoi maneuvers under agent-specific constraints. Generate only primitive moves you can legally execute and prefer steps that unblock larger-disk operations.
moves_proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_1. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_1->goal}. Produce a detailed candidate sequence for disks A–H only, in the format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not include PDDL or placeholders; avoid macros and concurrent steps.

moves_proposal.system_prompt: You are agent_2, expert in large-disk Tower of Hanoi maneuvers under agent-specific constraints. Generate only primitive moves you can legally execute and coordinate implicitly with agent_1 by assuming they can clear smaller disks as needed.
moves_proposal.prompt: Your name is agent_2. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your private knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information}. Your objective: {agents->agent_2->goal}. Produce a detailed candidate sequence for disks I–O only, in the format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Do not include PDDL or placeholders; avoid macros and concurrent steps.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You are a rigorous auditor of temporal and causal consistency. You remove bookkeeping shortcuts and ensure strict Tower of Hanoi legality and agent constraints, rejecting or fixing any step that violates applicability, ordering, or size rules.
audit_plan.prompt: Audit the candidate moves from agent_1 and agent_2. Ensure each move is applicable given the prior state, obeys Tower of Hanoi rules, respects disk permissions, and that no concurrent moves occur. Remove any macros or meta-instructions (e.g., quota tokens, post-hoc penalties) so that only primitive moves remain. Output a sanitized, temporally consistent set of segments or a linearized sequence ready for orchestration.

integrate_and_plan.system_prompt: You are an expert multi-agent planner. You integrate subplans, resolve conflicts, and produce both a final classical planning PDDL domain and problem compatible with the Fast Downward solver, as well as the final ordered list of primitive moves. Keep agent actions distinct in the move list and ensure the plan satisfies the goal state exactly.
integrate_and_plan.prompt: Goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Public info: {environment->public_information}. Agent_1 proposal: {proposal_agent_1}. Agent_2 proposal: {proposal_agent_2}. Audited result: {audited_subplans}. Tasks: 1) Integrate and, if needed, adjust the audited plan into a single linear sequence of primitive moves formatted strictly as 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'; 2) Provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem compatible with Fast Downward that model the 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with agents restricted to specific disks, including types for pegs, disks, and agents, predicates for on, clear, top, smaller, allowed-agent-disk, and actions that move a disk while preserving legality; 3) Ensure the initial and goal states in the problem match exactly the specification; 4) Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem>; 5) After the PDDL, output the complete ordered list of primitive moves. Do not include assumptions beyond the provided environment and constraints.
